posts.subject: Emergency comms general
posts.body:
I suggest you all become familiar with ham radio, networking and related topics.
I'll begin.
There's this cool thing called QRSS which can be used to send text **very** slowly halfway around the world with the power of a 9 volt battery for weeks using morse code and the magic of computer software.
https://www.amateur-radio-wiki.net/index.php?title=QRSS
There a reason it's one of the watchlist keywords used by the NSA. If you look for it on /pol/ archives you'll see it's just spammed among other keywords to make this kind of tracking less effective, but there aren't many mentions about it on there other than that.

>>c2692628-8eb0-4ab4-ba0a-b9fa1c093695
Calm down fag. It's merely been two days. Greece wasn't built in a day. I'm sure tards said the same thing it the late 90s when filesharing came up. This system will be gradually improved over the years, there is more than enough bandwidth available, the software just needs to be optimized to be able to use it.

>>c87dab8c-7a64-4348-aef5-10c10b1ff47f
Why not create a torrent for it?

==Friendly reminder to upload your board software to the latest version==
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/14r48CcSSyoNo1PNhy6uWriqpopMUfqfUX:tech:25e41ec7-13d5-4a07-881a-b3b05b3ec8a1
It fixes security bugs and now my client actually downloads data '''much''' faster for some reason.
If you are a normalfag, you '''will''' have issues with the migration, as there are a few steps lacking, like deleting all .db files and pasting logo.png over the default one. Make sure to have a spare Zeronet install so I can help you.

>>f63c74b1-56dd-430a-a6b3-b99d9ab9b79c
Can confirm. I still think minifying the files is kinda retarded (only advantage is it helps distinguish library code from Millchan's code), but at least now anons can run their own audited code by replacing the default one.

>>700810fd-1124-419e-9a36-1be9f0aaade7
If you click on an image or video it probably prioritizes it over anything you haven't clicked on.
>>a86efb3e-d1f0-47a2-9388-5ed34b400f6d
Add the full list of trackers http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D/?:users/13E1NfoEM9eYfxk3mZQTLW5qYBekTp5W7v:pol:ee6ef0b3-be83-484f-8d8d-5987fce71d3d

>>49620410-5073-46ec-ad11-58e8c257c8c9
>being this much of a leecher
You weren't supposed to buy your computer directly from Israel anon.

>>80c504dc-a1c2-4797-9b21-78e36d69f038
At least now I'm now getting my porn from the darknet, so I guess I got a little closer to getting rid of depression.

>>f88b20c4-4f65-41cf-9e1d-379600854105
>THe board owner has made modifications to millchan
If you read the whole sticky, he clearly doesn't know what he's doing. For example, suggesting you don't really need to use Tor if you want to stay private, or that he can't censor anything on this board when with his private key he can silently delete or override any of the board's data.
If he really did made significant changes to the thread, even though Millchan is under a very permissive license which allows you to do whatever, he should post a changelist or the git log along with the source code. In fact, if he doesn't he is violating the licenses of the libraries the board uses, whether they are GPL or LGPL, because they're part of the derived work the anon is distributed.
>namely muted posters not always being actually muted.
You got it backwards. That bug is part of 08chan's code, and it's allegedly fixed on the current version of Millchan. I have my doubts about it working on Millchan, but I'm pretty sure muting content doesn't delete it from the user's hard drive on 08chan's software either.
>but a seperate version of the code with more differences than just bug fixes and features. 
That are made by a team that made the software in the first place, not the guy that just deployed it and allegedly made some changes that are so small they don't change the interface or compatibility between clients in any way.
>I have seen a lot of people suggesting that the board owner is simply asleep at the wheel but If you actually read the sticky you can see why this is not the case.
Actually if you read the sticky you'll find he is. I mentioned two gross issues with what he said. What are you arguments for saying he does know what he's doing?

>>62cd4600-fe0b-44ed-9981-d3d3408bdbb9
What is their decentralized impossible to censor site anyways. She can't be lying, can she?

>>ef607e67-b4f3-4436-a93e-1ea400c7bb7d
Op doesn't control that. It's a Zeronet wide feature.

>>1d08d362-a1c4-4b2b-a8a8-f08eb0d07604
Pointing the domain to a different IP is not moving the data you brainlet.

>>5063c672-a646-453f-8db7-13f4c28eab60
I was going to save this pic in case I didn't have it already. Then I realized I already have it on disk.
